column4: i don't know dpkg-divert, but maybe you can try running dpkg -i on that .deb file, and try to see what the error is
take a look at 'man dpkg' for debug flags -- there are lots under -d

dpkg-divert: `diversion of /usr/lib32/libGL.so.1 to /usr/lib32/fglrx/libGL.so.1.xlibmesa by xorg-driver-fglrx' clashes with `diversion of /usr/lib32/libGL.so.1 to /usr/lib32/libGL.so.1.distrib by xorg-driver-fglrx'
hmm. maybe remove the mesa drivers ?
the package is conflicting with itself... ?
'.. by xorg-driver-fglrx conflicts with ... by xorg-driver-fglrx'
do you have an xorg-driver-fglrx package already installed?
didn't output anything at all in bash
so, not installed. Sorry, i don't have a clue -- at a guess, that package is fubared. I can't see how it can conflict with itself
i don't know -- haven't played with amd64/ati at all
ok. i would never ever have known that.
